title: Mike Lindup
text:
Michael David Lindup (born 17 March 1959) is a musician best known as the <a href="keyboard%20instrument">keyboard</a> player and <a href="falsetto">falsetto</a> <a href="human%20voice">voiced</a> <a href="singing">singer</a>, who joined with <a href="Mark%20King%20%28musician%29">Mark King</a> and brothers <a href="Phil%20Gould%20%28musician%29">Phil</a> and <a href="Boon%20Gould">Boon Gould</a> to form the <a href="United%20Kingdom">British</a> <a href="jazz-funk">jazz-funk</a>/<a href="pop%20rock">pop rock</a> band, <a href="Level%2042">Level 42</a>.
Early life.
Lindup was born in <a href="London">London</a>, England but he attended <a href="Chetham%27s%20School%20of%20Music">Chetham's School of Music</a> in Manchester where he studied piano, percussion and composition, and sang in senior and chamber choirs, later graduating to the <a href="Guildhall%20School%20of%20Music%20and%20Drama">Guildhall School of Music and Drama</a>. There his musical experience spread to include playing orchestral percussion in concert at the Royal Festival and Albert Halls, drums and keyboards in jazz ensembles and participating in pop workshops.
In 1985, he played in the <a href="bateria">bateria</a> of the London School of Samba in the <a href="Notting%20Hill%20Carnival">Notting Hill Carnival</a>. Three founder members of the LSS subsequently played on his first solo LP "Changes" in 1990.
Career.
Since July 2000, he has been part of the live line-up of UK/<a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian outfit <a href="Da%20Lata">Da Lata</a>, playing keyboards, percussion and providing backing vocals, who have been performing from clubs to festivals in the UK and Europe, U.S., Canada, Japan, South Africa and China.
In 2006, he rejoined Level 42, replacing Lyndon Connah, for touring appearances and the <a href="sound%20recording%20and%20reproduction">recording</a> of the <a href="album">album</a> "<a href="Retroglide%20%28album%29">Retroglide</a>".
In 2009, he appeared on Phil Gould's first solo album, "Watertight".
In 2012, he dueted with <a href="Leee%20John">Leee John</a> on a version of "<a href="Something%20About%20You%20%28Level%2042%20song%29">Something About You</a>" at the <a href="Leicester%20Square%20Theatre">Leicester Square Theatre</a>, London.
Personal life.
His mother is the actress, singer and songwriter <a href="Nadia%20Cattouse">Nadia Cattouse</a> and his father was <a href="David%20Lindup">David Lindup</a>.
